ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

amalEvaluation.charity_name: Islamic Society of Northwest Suburbs of Chicago

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: masakin (+5); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 27/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Separate restricted/endowment funds from operating reserves and publish a clear reserve-use policy.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Islamic Society of Northwest Suburbs of Chicago shows moderate alignment and moderate impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Your most generous donation (ZAKAAT). Suggested amounts. $500Helps fund an awareness campaign. $1,500 Supports our core operations. $3,000Enables us to expand our services. Other amount. Designation. Zakat. Donate and Support. (Source: https://isns.org/donation-for-construction/)

all_citations.claim: The organization provides religious services, Quranic teaching, and youth education programs.
The charity reported $4,092,615 in total revenue, a 92.5% program expense ratio, and 117.3 months of working capital.
The organization offers various donation options and is recognized as Zakat-eligible.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization demonstrates excellent financial health and efficiency, though its overall score is moderated by limited third-party impact data and medium data confidence. It remains a high-fit option for Muslim donors due to its Zakat-eligible status and essential community services.
areas_for_improvement: Limited external impact data or third-party verification of program outcomes
Data confidence is currently at a medium level, suggesting a need for more transparent reporting

dimension_explanations.alignment: ISNS shows high alignment for Muslim donors as a Zakat-eligible institution providing essential religious and cultural services [3]. The organization's long-standing track record in performing marriages, funeral services, and Friday congregations establishes it as a pillar of the local community [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on capacity building through its Little Scholar Early Childhood Program and religious services [1]. While it maintains a robust financial position with 117.3 months of working capital, the lack of cost-per-beneficiary data results in a medium impact score [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Islamic Society of Northwest Suburbs of Chicago serves as a vital community hub providing comprehensive religious services, youth education, and spiritual guidance.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 92.5%, indicating efficient use of funds for core services
Strong financial stability with 117.3 months of working capital
Highly efficient fundraising operations costing only $0.01 per $1 raised
baseline_narrative.summary: The Islamic Society of Northwest Suburbs of Chicago (ISNS) is a religious non-profit dedicated to the teaching of the Holy Quran, daily congregational prayers, and Islamic education for children [1]. The organization reported a total revenue of $4,092,615 and maintains a high program expense ratio of 92.5%, ensuring the vast majority of funds directly support its religious and educational missions [2].
